title: House Tackles Ban on Imports From China’s Xinjiang Region
sub_head: Vote follows bipartisan deal on Uyghur Forced Labor Prevention Act
body:
WASHINGTON—The House plans to vote later Tuesday to ban imports from China’s Xinjiang region over concerns over the use of forced labor, after a bipartisan agreement was reached with the Senate on the language of the legislation.
The Uyghur Forced Labor Prevention Act bans imports from Xinjiang over concerns over the use of forced labor. The compromise bill is expected to pass the Senate this week. Human-rights activists and some scholars say Chinese authorities have locked up a million or more Uyghurs and other minorities in internment camps as part of a ethnic-assimilation campaign.
